sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {4, 5, 6}. Find out the sets (AxB)⋃(BxA) and (BxA)⋃(AxB), and prove that they are not equal, thus showing that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
